query:
From the following patient information, what is the most likely diagnosis? Use multiple queries or reasoning steps as necessary, and provide a rank-ordered list of up to 10 diagnoses, even if there is insufficient information to make a definitive diagnosis. If you are unsure, provide a list of possible diagnoses with the most likely one first.

Patient ID: 6
Patient age: 5 years
Patient sex: Female
Patient features: Short stature, Elevated diastolic blood pressure, Reduced bone mineral density, Lipodystrophy, Alopecia, Reduced subcutaneous adipose tissue, Hypodontia, Scleroderma, Proptosis, Progressive clavicular acroosteolysis, Osteolytic defects of the phalanges of the hand, Prominent superficial blood vessels, Circumoral cyanosis, Failure to thrive, Micrognathia, Mottled pigmentation, Coxa valga.
Excluded patient features: Ankyloglossia, High palate, Delayed eruption of teeth, Shark teeth, Abnormality of vision.

messages.content:
To provide a rank-ordered list of possible diagnoses for this patient, I will:

1. Search for diseases associated with the patient's phenotypic features.
2. Exclude diseases that are associated with the excluded features.
3. Rank the diseases based on the overlap of features with the patient.

Let me begin by searching for diseases associated with the patient's features.

messages.content:
I have identified a list of diseases and phenotypic features associated with the patient's symptoms. To refine the diagnosis, I will now exclude diseases associated with the excluded features (e.g., ankyloglossia, high palate, delayed eruption of teeth, shark teeth, and abnormality of vision). Then, I will rank the remaining diseases based on the overlap with the patient's features.

Let me proceed with this step.

messages.name: search

messages.content:
I have identified diseases and features associated with the excluded patient features. Now, I will cross-reference the diseases associated with the patient's features and exclude those linked to the excluded features. Then, I will rank the remaining diseases based on the overlap with the patient's features.

Let me proceed with this analysis.

function.name: run_query
function.arguments: {"query":"MATCH (d:biolink_Disease)-[:biolink_has_phenotype]->(p:biolink_PhenotypicFeature) WHERE p.name IN ['Short stature', 'Elevated diastolic blood pressure', 'Reduced bone mineral density', 'Lipodystrophy', 'Alopecia', 'Reduced subcutaneous adipose tissue', 'Hypodontia', 'Scleroderma', 'Proptosis', 'Progressive clavicular acroosteolysis', 'Osteolytic defects of the phalanges of the hand', 'Prominent superficial blood vessels', 'Circumoral cyanosis', 'Failure to thrive', 'Micrognathia', 'Mottled pigmentation', 'Coxa valga'] AND NOT (d)-[:biolink_has_phenotype]->(:biolink_PhenotypicFeature {name: 'Ankyloglossia'}) AND NOT (d)-[:biolink_has_phenotype]->(:biolink_PhenotypicFeature {name: 'High palate'}) AND NOT (d)-[:biolink_has_phenotype]->(:biolink_PhenotypicFeature {name: 'Delayed eruption of teeth'}) AND NOT (d)-[:biolink_has_phenotype]->(:biolink_PhenotypicFeature {name: 'Shark teeth'}) AND NOT (d)-[:biolink_has_phenotype]->(:biolink_PhenotypicFeature {name: 'Abnormality of vision'}) RETURN d, COUNT(p) AS feature_overlap ORDER BY feature_overlap DESC LIMIT 10"}

messages.content: {'result_as_graph': {'type': 'graph', 'data': {'nodes': [{'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0019321', 'caption': 'atypical Werner syndrome', 'name': 'atypical Werner syndrome', 'description': 'A heterogeneous group of cases that are clinically diagnosed as Werner syndrome (WS) but do not carry WRN gene mutations. Similar to classical WS caused by WRN mutations, patients generally exhibit an aged appearance and common age-related disorders at earlier ages compared to the general population.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0008389', 'caption': 'autosomal dominant Robinow syndrome', 'name': 'autosomal dominant Robinow syndrome', 'description': 'Autosomal dominant Robinow syndrome (DRS) is the more common type of Robinow syndrome (RS) characterized by mild to moderate limb shortening and abnormalities of the head, face and external genitalia.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0013523', 'caption': 'Nestor-Guillermo progeria syndrome', 'name': 'Nestor-Guillermo progeria syndrome', 'description': 'A premature aging syndrome, autosomal recessive, characterized by lipoatrophy, osteoporosis, and very severe osteolysis. Patients have no cardiovascular impairment, diabetes mellitus, or hypertriglyceridemia, but suffer profound skeletal abnormalities that affect their quality of life.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0859147', 'caption': 'Marbach-Rustad progeroid syndrome', 'name': 'Marbach-Rustad progeroid syndrome', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0011273', 'caption': 'H syndrome', 'name': 'H syndrome', 'description': 'A systemic inherited histiocytosis, with characteristic cutaneous findings accompanying systemic manifestations. H syndrome refers to the major clinical findings of hyperpigmentation, hypertrichosis, hepatosplenomegaly, heart anomalies, hearing loss, hypogonadism, low height, and occasionally, hyperglycemia/diabetes mellitus. Due to overlapping clinical features, H syndrome is now considered to include pigmented hypertrichosis with insulin dependent diabetes mellitus syndrome (PHID), Faisalabad histiocytosis (FHC) and familial sinus histiocytosis with massive lymphadenopathy (FSHML).', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0700107', 'caption': 'chromosome 19q13.11 deletion syndrome, distal', 'name': 'chromosome 19q13.11 deletion syndrome, distal', 'description': 'Chromosome 19q13.11 deletion syndrome in which the distal region was deleted.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0014887', 'caption': 'bone marrow failure syndrome 3', 'name': 'bone marrow failure syndrome 3', 'description': 'Any bone marrow failure syndrome in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the DNAJC21 gene.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0020682', 'caption': 'Ehlers-Danlos syndrome, spondylodysplastic type, 1', 'name': 'Ehlers-Danlos syndrome, spondylodysplastic type, 1', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0019407', 'caption': 'microcephalic osteodysplastic dysplasia, Saul-Wilson type', 'name': 'microcephalic osteodysplastic dysplasia, Saul-Wilson type', 'description': 'A bone development disease characterized by early developmental delay primarily involving speech, distinct facial features, short stature, brachydactyly, clubfoot deformities, cataracts, and microcephaly that has material basis in heterozygous mutation in COG4 on chromosome 16q22.1.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}, {'data': {'id': 'MONDO:0012794', 'caption': 'ANE syndrome', 'name': 'ANE syndrome', 'description': 'ANE syndrome is a rare, genetic, neuro-endocrino-cutaneous disorder characterized by highly variable degrees of alopecia, moderate to severe intellectual disability, progressive, late-onset motor deterioration and combined anterior pituitary hormone deficiency, manifesting with central hypogonadotropic hypogonadism, delayed or absent puberty, growth hormone deficiency (resulting in short stature), progressive central adrenal insufficiency and a hypoplastic anterior pituitary gland. Additional features include hypodontia, flexural reticulate hyperpigmentation, gynecomastia, microcephaly and kyphoscoliosis.', 'category': 'biolink:Disease', 'label': 'biolink:Disease'}}], 'edges': []}}, 'result_as_table': {'type': 'table', 'data': []}}
messages.name: run_query

messages.content:
Based on the analysis of the patient's features and the exclusion of diseases associated with the excluded features, here is a rank-ordered list of possible diagnoses:

1. [Atypical Werner Syndrome](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0019321): A condition resembling Werner syndrome but without WRN gene mutations, characterized by premature aging and age-related disorders.
2. [Autosomal Dominant Robinow Syndrome](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0008389): A syndrome with mild to moderate limb shortening, facial abnormalities, and genital anomalies.
3. [Nestor-Guillermo Progeria Syndrome](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0013523): A premature aging syndrome with lipoatrophy, osteoporosis, and severe osteolysis, but no cardiovascular impairment or diabetes.
4. [Marbach-Rustad Progeroid Syndrome](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0859147): A progeroid syndrome with features of premature aging.
5. [H Syndrome](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0011273): A systemic histiocytosis with hyperpigmentation, hypertrichosis, and systemic manifestations like hepatosplenomegaly and hearing loss.
6. [Chromosome 19q13.11 Deletion Syndrome, Distal](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0700107): A chromosomal deletion syndrome with variable features.
7. [Bone Marrow Failure Syndrome 3](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0014887): A syndrome caused by mutations in the DNAJC21 gene, leading to bone marrow failure.
8. [Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome, Spondylodysplastic Type 1](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0020682): A subtype of Ehlers-Danlos syndrome with skeletal dysplasia.
9. [Microcephalic Osteodysplastic Dysplasia, Saul-Wilson Type](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0019407): A bone development disorder with short stature, brachydactyly, and microcephaly.
10. [ANE Syndrome](https://monarchinitiative.org/MONDO:0012794): A rare neuro-endocrino-cutaneous disorder with alopecia, intellectual disability, and combined anterior pituitary hormone deficiency.

These diagnoses are ranked based on the overlap of features with the patient's presentation. Further clinical evaluation and genetic testing would be necessary to confirm the diagnosis.
